pros: Exceptionally stable; Effective GuideRails technology; Ideal for heel strikers; Superior build quality; Responsive DNA Loft v3 foam; Durable and grippy outsole; Comfortable and breathable upper; Good volume in the upper for those with wide feet
cons: High weight can lead to leg fatigue; Not versatile for faster paces or longer distances.; Becomes too firm in cold weather
RR_verdict: The Brooks Beast GTS 23 is far from ordinary, offering top-notch stability but also tipping the scale with its massive weight. We believe that if you can overlook the heft, this shoe shines with exceptional support from its geometry and GuideRails technology. Furthermore, we found it offers excellent breathability and a design meticulously crafted for heel strikers a stable ride.
awards: Top pick in best running shoes with a wide toebox (2023), Top pick in best Brooks walking shoes (2024)
